data.text:
@Delicious_Tacos Also I read this today and I think you should too.
https://t.co/PUMd22GApU

@Trollhammer71 @Delicious_Tacos Best dosing protocol I've found for Vitamin C is to take Sodium Ascorbate powder in water.  Up the dose until things get "loose", then reduce it until that problem resolves.  This is a how you find the max amount your body will absorb.
@Delicious_Tacos What kind of documentation did they give you for taking the shot? Do they give you a certificate or something? I'm genuinely curious as to how this gets recorded.

@Delicious_Tacos I'm not sure why one thinks the booster shots for new variants won't work. this one works very well for specific known strains and the boosters will do the same for those specific strains, and this thing mutates but not as fast as the flu
@Delicious_Tacos @Trollhammer71 Why do you need to supplenent D, don't you get enough sun in California?
@Delicious_Tacos I was exposed two weeks ago.  Working directly with someone who was not symptomatic yet.  I tested negative and am fine.  Take NAC every day. Have for years. Its powerful shit.
@DookieSupreme Well there’s a lid for every pot
@Delicious_Tacos I maintain that NAC and vitamin D is the best way to go.  NAC also helps you recover from exercise.
@Delicious_Tacos Probably the zinc did it.
@Trollhammer71 Vitamins C, D, E and zinc
@Delicious_Tacos I don't know what you have in US, i get regular flu shots second year, no sides for me, it works apparently (no flu).
@Delicious_Tacos They’re gonna make regular Covid shots mandatory lmao
@Delicious_Tacos What the heck were you taking?
@Delicious_Tacos You'll get the new experimental Covid-2X mutation vaccine every October and you'll like it 💉
@Delicious_Tacos Brilliant play, suiciding by taking the vaccine so that your writings would be properly respected after your death, like all great authors

@justabuzzard @Delicious_Tacos Literally nobody who has gotten the vaccine has ended up in the hospital sick with Covid. You feel crummy for a a few days after the booster shot and then you can resume your life without fear of severe Covid symptoms.
@Delicious_Tacos It takes a lot of chutzpah for a guy named Delicious Tacos to criticize Big Diarrhea

@Delicious_Tacos My understanding is the booster shot activates an immune response and that’s why you feel ill. I understand vaccine hesitancy since they got this out so quickly, but I’ll choose exposure to the vaccine over the virus. Even healthy people have died, had strokes, etc from Covid.
Of note: taking vitamins to prevent corona like Joe Rogan told me also made me sick. Supplements are a conspiracy from Big Diarrhea
@Delicious_Tacos are you feeling sterile?
Make your own decisions, either choice is not the end of the world
Get healthy and get in shape
@Delicious_Tacos It doesn't have to prevent infection, just prevent you from ending up in the ICU.
Like the flu shot, vulnerable people should take it. I took it to “do my part” for public health and bc I think it’ll be required for travel
